instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message:
Hey I have a 820-00281 Motherboard with no power. No water damage but inside was really dusty. I got the following readings

ppbus_g3h = 12.61v

PP3v3_G3H = 3.4v

PP3v3_SUS = missing

PM_BATLOW_L = missing

PP3V0_G3H= 3.0v

PCH_INTRUDER_L= 2.8v

PM_DSW_PWRGD = missing

PM_SLP_SUS_L= missing

RTC_RESET_L= 3.0v

PCH_SRTCRST_L= 3.0v

3V3_S5 = missing


Can you please help me troubleshoot this unit?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: will i need an oscilloscope for this?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: Okay i tried with the hz setting on my multimeter and got 32.76khz on sysclk_clk32k_pch (u1900 pin 10)

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: 12.6 is low for PPBUS seems like an SMC issue. Any corrosion near it?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: no corrosion present. I see the sxhematic says 13.1

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: Yeah which makes me think the SMC is possibly pulling it down similar to older machines. Inspect near U7000 for corrosion as well. I think one or the other could be keeping PPBUS low which explains why many of the voltages you are missing are missing

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: U7000 is clean but I do see some crud around U7100. For the newer devices isnt U7100 the power ic?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message:
U7100 is CPU power supply controller.

Check around U7800, SMC_PM_G2_EN, PP3V3_PMICLDO.

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message:
Around U7800 looks clean

SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.4v

PP3V3_PMICLDO = 3.3v

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message:
So would the crud around U7100 cause anything. its EXTREMELY minor and can only be seen under the scope but there. I went ahead and did a beep test to check short to ground. I have beep on:

CPU_VCCGTSENSE_P

CPUCORE_ISUMN

CPU_VCCSENSE_N

Are these suppose to beep due to low resistance or are these lines shorted?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message:
I don't exactly know the corresponding values for your CPU.
But yes, CPU rails have usually very low values...

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: Thank you, so do you have any other suggestions [USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] ?

threads.title: 820-00281-A No power
threads.message: Check if battery is charging; monitoring R7060 voltage.
